summary:
The Security Council:
- Calls on parties to revitalize the peace process, including work in the Coordinating Council, and to implement confidence-building measures agreed in Yalta (para 12).
- Reminds parties to refrain from actions impeding the peace process (para 13).
- Stresses the need for progress on refugees and internally displaced persons, and calls for their safe and dignified return (para 14).
- Urges the Abkhaz side to protect returnees and facilitate the return of displaced persons (para 15).
- Welcomes consideration of the joint assessment mission's recommendations and urges their implementation (para 16).
- Endorses adding a civilian police component to UNOMIG (para 17).
- Calls on the Abkhaz side to improve law enforcement and address education for the ethnic Georgian population (para 18).
- Condemns ceasefire violations and calls for public dissociation from militant rhetoric (paras 19-20).
- Welcomes calm in the Kodori Valley and urges peaceful resolution (para 21).
- Condemns the abduction of UNOMIG personnel and demands accountability (para 22).
- Welcomes safeguards for helicopter flights and calls for accountability for past incidents (para 23).
- Calls for improved security for UNOMIG and CIS peacekeeping force patrols (para 24).
- Underlines the primary responsibility of both sides to ensure security and freedom of movement for international personnel (para 25).
- Welcomes UNOMIG's review of security arrangements (para 26).
- Extends UNOMIG's mandate until 31 January 2004 (para 27).
- Requests regular updates from the Secretary-General (para 28).
- Decides to remain actively seized of the matter (para 29).
